attributes.action: Legislate to encourage MPs (past and present) to repay to the Exchequer the relevant profits arising on the sale of subsidised second homes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister should invite all MPs, past and present to sign a pledge that they will pay back to the Exchequer some of the eventual gain on any sale of property owned by them or their family and which has been subsidised by the state. This repayment should be assessed by taking the  proportion of the expenses claimed over the total costs during the period of ownership and applying it to the actual gain.
The Prime Minister should enact legislation to ensure that any sitting MP who does not sign this pledge resigns immediately and offers himself for re-election. Similarly if a former MP does not sign the pledge, he should be stripped of any title and be prevented from holding public office.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
